attributes.action: Better Legislation In The Online Safety Bill, 2021 (Draft) For Women
attributes.additional_details: Little or anything has been mentioned in the bill draft so far in regards to women online. All emphasis has been on children and young adults
attributes.background: Add in harsher legislation in relation to online abuse towards women. This may include regulations set by the Government for social media companies for more in depth and harder registering systems for social media platforms. This will make it harder for people to act anonymously online.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned that the draft Online Safety Bill does not contain adequate provisions to prevent online abuse against women, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to be made to this Bill.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
